com.noctarius.tengi.core.connection

Interface HandshakeHandler


  • public interface HandshakeHandler
    The HandshakeHandler interface describes a handler implementation that, on server-side, is able to verify connection requests and can either accept a handshake or deny it. On client-side it can extract additional information (like data to preload or additional connection- or version- information).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Handshake handleHandshake(Identifier connectionId, Handshake handshake)
      Verifies or handles a handshake request or response.

    • Method Detail

      • handleHandshake

        Handshake handleHandshake(Identifier connectionId,
                          Handshake handshake)

        Verifies or handles a handshake request or response. On server-side the verification is successful when another instance of Handshake is returned (in this case a handshake response) or it is denied if null is returned, in the latter case, the connection is closed. If the same handshake instance is returned an IllegalStateException will be thrown to the connection and the connection is closed.

        On client-side, there is no additional verification step and the return value is ignored. It does not matter what the actual return value will be.

        Parameters:
        connectionId - the connectionId for the handshake operation
        handshake - the Handshake object to handle
        Returns:
        another handshake instance to accept the handshake request, otherwise null
